Skin Burn: Remove restictive clothing, rinse with cool water, protect/cover with loose bandage, prevent shock and treat pain with ibprophen
Chicken Pox: Use ibprophen for pain, don't itch the bumps (tap or pat if needed), wear loose clothing, stay hydrated, see a doctor if you have other underlying medical issues
Nose bleed: Sit up and lean forward slightly, pinch the nose just below the bone and apply pressure for 5 minutes, if bleeding does not stop after 10 minutes or if it is hard to breathe, call a doctor.
